intro: Catoblastus velutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf catoblastus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
